intro: Aster polyphyllus, commonly known as the New Zealand aster, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of purple and white. The plant has a rosette of basal leaves and can grow up to 1 meter in height. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in forest margins and open areas. Aster polyphyllus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also an important plant in traditional Māori culture.
